casebody.data:
J. E. Slater, Plaintiff in Error, v. Elbert D. Ball, Defendant in Error.Gen. No. 22,597.

(Not to be reported in full.)

Error to the Municipal Court of Chicago; the Hon. Edmund K. Jarecki, Judge, presiding. Heard in this court at the October term, 1916.Affirmed.Opinion filed February 5, 1917.

Statement of the Case.

Action by J. E. Slater, plaintiff, against Elbert D. Ball, defendant, to recover $451.50 upon a note given by defendant. .From a judgment for defendant, plaintiff brings error.

Abstract of the Decision.Bills and notes, § 451*—when evidence is sufficient to show payment of note. Evidence held sufficient to show that the note sued on and given by the defendant was paid by the conveyance to the plaintiff of a farm.Joseph M. Connery, for plaintiff in error.No appearance for defendant in error.

See Illinois Notes Digest, Vola. XI to XV, and Cumulative Quarterly, same topic and section number.

 Mr. Justice Holdom

delivered the opinion of the court.
